item.title: Minister defends suspending Townsville Mayor Troy Thompson on full pay
item.description: Queensland's local government minister says she had no choice but to agree to suspend Troy Thompson for 12 months on his full salary amid a corruption investigation into claims about his military history.

item.title: In a contest of influence in Papua New Guinea, Australia triumphed over China through our shared love of footy
item.description: The "soft power" aspect to this sports diplomacy initiative has never been a secret. But in the game of regional politics, Australia went in for the hard tackle.

item.title: Have Your Say: What was the issue, policy or event that decided your vote?
item.description: After a five-week campaign, the results are in with Labor returned to government. Is there a policy or issue that swayed your vote? Have Your Say.

item.title: German startup's space rocket explodes seconds after take-off from Norway
item.description: German startup Isar Aerospace says this was an initial test as part of a project aimed at kickstarting satellite launches from Europe.

item.title: NASA astronauts speak out for the first time following unexpected nine-month mission to space
item.description: Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams didn't shy away from accepting some of the blame for Boeing's bungled test flight.

item.title: How a kid from Pemberton helped lead a landmark commercial Moon landing
item.description: Aim for the stars, Jaxon Liebeck tells students as he returns to his school in WA a month after directing a landmark space mission.

item.title: Voters tell ABC's Your Say they want politicians with a vision, not bickering
item.description: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they want courage and vision from politicians, not bickering.

item.title: Push for seniors' dental scheme grows ahead of federal election
item.description: Imagine living in aged care and not having your teeth or dentures properly cleaned and checked each day. That's a risk faced by elderly Australians, prompting calls for the next federal government to boost oral health training and services.

item.title: Australians tell ABC's Your Say they are struggling more than ever with housing costs
item.description: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they are struggling more than ever with housing costs.

item.title: Australia's growing cohort of tenants fear they will rent forever
item.description: Home ownership rates in Australia have been falling for decades, and with rental vacancies at record lows and prices at historic highs, many fear their dream of owning a home may be out of reach. Some experts say rental caps could help.

item.title: Graduates in 'debt vortex' as HECS front and centre for first time in an election
item.description: New research shows a sharp rise in HECS debts, despite graduate earning power declining, as student loans become a potent election issue for the first time.

item.title: Housing advocates seek federal funding election promise for co-op model
item.description: Advocates admit co-operative housing models are not for everyone but say for the right residents, they offer more security and affordable pricing than traditional rentals.

item.title: NRL clubs to be allowed to sign two PNG pathway players outside of cap ahead of team's 2028 entry
item.description: A Papua New Guinea-based team will enter the NRL in 2028, but the league hopes to have a number of players from the Kumuls flourishing in the league in the preceding years.

item.title: Next-generation voters call for better engagement ahead of federal election
item.description: Young people in Albury say issues that directly affect them and their communities are not being addressed by major parties for the 2025 election campaign.

item.title: Melbourne seat of Calwell highlights Labor woes as Gaza pain galvanises Muslim voters
item.description: Dissatisfaction with the Albanese government's stance on Israel-Palestine among many Arab and Muslim voters threatens to unseat Labor MPs, in some places for the first time.

item.title: Cost of living, housing among key concerns in SA marginal seat of Boothby
item.description: At this year’s federal election, the South Australian seat of Boothby is one of the state’s two marginal seats. As part of the ABC’s “Your Say” campaign, we spoke to residents in the electorate about their biggest concerns.

item.title: Energy projects in South West WA threaten votes for major federal parties
item.description: Australia's two major parties have tied their federal election fates to controversial energy projects in WA's South West where the issues have polarised voters.

item.title: Tiwi Islanders eager to have their say as remote voting for the federal election begins
item.description: Voters in the small remote community of Pirlangimpi on the Tiwi Islands, north of Darwin, have become some of the first to cast their votes for the federal election.

item.title: Mobile coverage is an election issue in regional areas. What's been promised?
item.description: For many regional and remote Australians, reliable mobile coverage can be life-saving. They are desperate for both sides of politics to take meaningful action towards eliminating black spots.

item.title: Health, climate and community sport: What older voters in the Tasmanian seat of Bass are talking about this election
item.description: The federal seat of Bass is held by a margin of just 1.4 per cent. For these older voters who live in the electorate, health, climate and community sport are the issues that will decide their vote.

item.title: NASA astronauts conduct fifth all-female spacewalk outside ISS
item.description: NASA astronauts Colonel Anne McClain and Major Nichole Ayers leave the International Space Station for almost 6 hours to to move an antenna and prepare the station for new solar panels.

item.title: Soviet spacecraft Kosmos 482 plunges to Earth after 53 years stuck in orbit
item.description: Russia's space agency says the Kosmos 482 lander has made an uncontrolled re-entry to Earth's atmosphere over the Indian Ocean.

item.title: Gilmour Space Technologies delays launch of Australia's first home-grown rocket, with hopes for take-off on Friday
item.description: After years of planning and preparations, Gilmour Space Technologies finally has clearance to launch its 23-metre Eris rocket from a purpose-built pad in north Queensland.

item.title: SpaceX Starship rocket explodes in latest setback to Musk's Mars mission
item.description: The company says the explosion was due to a "major anomaly", and says all personnel are safe.

item.title: Donald Trump calls Elon Musk's formation of a third US political party 'ridiculous'
item.description: The president has taken aim at Elon Musk's "America Party", saying that it would add to voter confusion in the United States and describing the tech billionaire as a "TRAIN WRECK".

item.title: Heather Ewart reflects on the tough road to Back Roads success
item.description: Heather Ewart was a powerhouse political reporter when she was asked to create a show about regional Australia. A decade later, and with her final season going to air, Ewart admits that getting the idea off the ground was no easy feat.

item.title: Scientists believe new colourful concrete on Sydney Harbour seawall could revive marine life
item.description: A year-long experiment in Sydney's iconic harbour found algae and barnacles were more likely to grow on the seawall's colourful concrete panels versus the grey panels.

item.title: No Return: Australia's Missing Billions
item.description: Four Corners is the home of Australian investigative journalism.

item.title: Australian-made rocket crashes after attempted north Queensland launch
item.description: Gilmour Space Technologies attempted to launch its rocket from a spaceport in the north Queensland community of Bowen in an Australian-first on Wednesday morning.

item.title: Australian-made rocket crashes shortly after launch
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Gilmour Space Technologies' rocket launch ended shortly after lift-off
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Australian-made Gilmour Space Technologies not giving up after rocket crash
item.description: Gilmour Space's orbital rocket Eris came down quickly after an engine failure this week, but the Australian company behind the attempt is undeterred.

item.title: Jeremy Rockliff intends to approve Marinus Link deal without releasing business case
item.description: Tasmanian Premier Jeremy Rockliff says he intends to approve the Marinus Link interconnector deal with the federal government, as he seeks final advice. A business case has not been released, and negotiations continued during the caretaker period.

item.title: Farmers say Victorian regulations are restricting practical renewable energy microgrids
item.description: Victorian government regulations limit the sharing of generated power between properties, even if they have the same owner. Farmers are calling for changes so they can capitalise on their own microgrids.

item.title: Tasmania signs on to Marinus Link power cable project despite government caretaker period
item.description: The state's energy minister tells ABC Radio Hobart he has signed the deal for the multi-billion-dollar undersea cable during the government caretaker period.

item.title: Office worker finds endangered spotted handfish dead on Hobart street
item.description: The handfish looked as if it had just "flopped out of the water" when it was discovered by an office worker in central Hobart.

item.title: Community campaigns to protect reef by extending boundaries of Victoria's smallest marine park
item.description: This fragile reef is just a few hundred metres from a popular Melbourne beach, and a group of passionate community members are doing all they can to save it.

item.title: Whales and dolphins at play
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Businesses want electrification costs covered as Solstice Energy shuts gas network
item.description: A business owner who spent $40,000 connecting to natural gas last year now faces a $20,000 bill to convert to electric, before Solstice Energy shuts the gas network in his town.

item.title: Search continues for missing couple Gregory Vaughan and Kim Worner, despite no traces found
item.description: It's been almost two weeks since Gregory Vaughan and Kim Worner left George Town Airport in northern Tasmania for a flight over Bass Strait. The search for them, their pet dog and their light plane is continuing, despite no trace being found.

item.title: Nate Byrne is voting for the marsupial mole
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Federal Court fines Qantas $90 million for illegally outsourcing ground handling workforce
item.description: The airline giant will face a $90 million penalty over its decision to illegally outsource more than 1,800 ground handling jobs during the COVID pandemic.

item.title: ACCC to investigate energy plans that promise savings but deliver poor value
item.description: The investigation comes as CHOICE filed its first 'super complaint' to the ACCC in May, flagging concerns that energy retailers use words like 'saver' for plans that are far from the cheapest.

item.title: Artist's interpretation of supernova origin
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Artist's interpretation of supernova origin
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: What it means to have your song 'KPopped': Kylie Minogue, the Spice Girls and Boy George find out
item.description: A new music show, in which global icons team up with K-pop idols to have their songs "KPopped", features Australian pop princess Kylie Minogue.

item.title: Blackout warnings for Queenslanders ahead of summer from Australian Energy Market Operator
item.description: The Australian Energy Market Operator says there are "short-term" challenges for the area and a "reliability gap".

item.title: The strange story of Garrison 'Gunslinger' St Clair, the American sent to find Robert Bogucki
item.description: Garrison St Clair was touted as an all-American rescuer sent to the Australian desert to find a missing adventurer. But soon after he entered the spotlight, his grand backstory began to unravel.

item.title: Southern right whale poo found at Fowlers Bay reveals clues about gut health
item.description: Whale poo found on a remote South Australian beach has the potential to help protect endangered southern right whales from climate change, by revealing clues about their diet and gut health.

item.title: Ichthyosaur fossil found
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Net zero transition at risk of stalling amid shortfall of 42,000 workers
item.description: The Powering Skills Organisation warns the current energy workforce of 300,000 energy, gas and renewables sector workers will not be sufficient to meet demand and further investment in training will be needed.

item.title: Cookie pie craze hits regional Victoria with people queuing for hours for bakery treat
item.description: The phenomenon of queuing for food has made its way to the regional Victorian town of Ballarat, with locals braving the winter cold, hoping to get their hands on a famous cookie pie.

item.title: Bumper turn-out for competitive agriculture entries at the Royal Adelaide Show
item.description: Farmers have turned out in droves to compete at South Australia's largest agricultural event after a challenging year facing drought conditions.

item.title: Three vehicles seized by police as part of investigation into disappearance of Brisbane man Andrew Burow
item.description: Andrew Burow, a 56-year-old cybersecurity expert from Kelvin Grove, has not been seen since Thursday, August 21.

item.title: Surge in berry consumption prompts potential dimethoate restriction
item.description: Australians are eating so many berries that regulators are considering restricting the use of a widely used pesticide.

item.title: Kimberley traditional owners visit their country after 'once-in-a-century' floods
item.description: More than two years since catastrophic floods in WA's far north devastated a wildlife sanctuary, traditional owners have returned to country.

item.title: Elephant seal Sammy returns to Portland, drawing onlookers and prompting warnings
item.description: Sammy the seal often pops up in the seaside Victorian town of Portland and has recently been photographed munching on a shark. He is loved by many, but authorities are warning people to keep their distance.

item.title: Human remains found as part of investigation into missing man Andrew Burow
item.description: Remains found at Maidenwell in Queensland's South Burnett region are yet to be formally identified, but investigators have been in contact with Andrew Burow's family.

item.title: Melbourne 'affordable' housing tenants face 17 per cent rent increase
item.description: A year after they moved into an "affordable" apartment in a new public-private housing development in inner Melbourne, Alix and Tiarn were told their rent would increase by 17 per cent. They say their experience highlights flaws in the model the Victorian government is using to redevelop its aging public housing towers.

item.title: Inquest examines death of First Nations woman at Lightning Ridge
item.description: A doctor admits he should have been called to see a woman before she died at the remote Lightning Ridge health centre, during a coronial inquest into her death.

item.title: Caged eggs to stay on supermarket shelves until 2030 as Coles abandons pledge
item.description: Coles says the cost of living and supply chain disruptions are behind its decision to continue selling caged eggs until 2030. A consumer expert says it is likely the supermarket's competitors will follow suit.

item.title: Australia's Sam Kerr left on bench in Chelsea's Women's Super League opener
item.description: Sam Kerr's long-awaited comeback is put on hold as she watches fellow Matilda Ellie Carpenter light up the start of the WSL season for Chelsea.

item.title: Aryna Sabalenka claims second straight US Open with win over Amanda Anisimova
item.description: World number one Aryna Sabalenka successfully defends her US Open title, with a straight-sets win in the final against American Amanda Anisimova at Flushing Meadows.

item.title: Calls for AFL to do more to address systemic racism and falling Indigenous numbers
item.description: Ten years after AFL great Adam Goodes was forced to leave the game, Indigenous player numbers have dwindled, online racist abuse is rife and insiders say elite private schools have dramatically narrowed the talent pathways. How can the league turn it around?

item.title: Remote WA community buys prefab Chinese houses after decades in unfit homes
item.description: Sick of waiting decades for repairs and new homes, an Indigenous community in WA pools funds to buy two houses, made in China from shipping containers, to house its most vulnerable residents.

item.title: On Father's Day, men reflect on how having kids has changed them
item.description: From learning patience and gratitude, to pushing past their comfort zone, we hear from six dads about the "transformative" experience of having children.

item.title: National Drought Forum convenes in SA to put policy under scrutiny
item.description: The nation's drought supports will come under scrutiny at a major national forum today as southern farmers continue to battle dry times.

item.title: Guard admits to watching TV in moments leading up to Indigenous man's death in custody, inquest hears
item.description: A guard has admitted to watching a soccer game on TV in the moments leading up to the death of an Indigenous inmate, an inquest has heard in its first day.

item.title: BHP scraps renewable energy projects, casting doubt on emissions targets
item.description: BHP has dumped plans for major renewable energy projects in the Pilbara, prompting concern the miner is backing away from emissions reduction goals.

item.title: Victoria becomes first Australian state to formally table treaty legislation in parliament
item.description: Victoria's historic treaty is promising to "reckon with the past" and empower the state's First Peoples — and explicitly declares it will not take anything away from the broader community.

item.title: 'Low levels of satisfaction' with healthcare in Canberra for endometriosis, menopause, identified in Women's Health Matters survey
item.description: A survey of women in Canberra about the state of their wellbeing and health reveals large gaps in access and affordability, as well as the staggering statistic that almost half of respondents felt doctors weren't taking them seriously.

item.title: Ange Postecoglou returns to Premier League management with Nottingham Forest after Nuno Espírito Santo sacking
item.description: Australian's Ange Postecolgou has been named as new head coach of Premier League side Nottingham Forest after the sacking of Nuno Espírito Santo.

item.title: Hopes Australia's first treaty with Aboriginal people will help close the gap
item.description: For Aboriginal people, it has been centuries in the making. As Victoria tables legislation for the country's first treaty with First Nations people, Indigenous leaders are urging other states and territories to follow suit.

item.title: Construction workers are at higher risk of suicide. Here's how to look out for them
item.description: Construction workers are nearly twice as likely to take their own lives as other employed Australian men of the same age. Understanding the risks can help us better support those we know in the industry.

item.title: In their Melbourne Fringe Show, First Trimester, performer Krishna Istha is seeking a sperm donor
item.description: Krishna Istha has made a habit of turning to performance to solve a problem. So when they needed help to find a sperm donor, the solution was obvious.

item.title: Alice Springs suicide prevention walk bolstered by funding announcements
item.description: A study will work with Indigenous researchers who will map cultural assets and integrate traditional healing to improve outcomes in remote centres.

item.title: Police used 'excessive' force on Aboriginal man in wheelchair, court finds
item.description: Body-worn video footage played to the Darwin Local Court captures a loud thud as an Aboriginal man with a disability is dropped into a police wagon, drawing an audible gasp from another officer.

item.title: Heritage protection top priority for Pilbara traditional owners
item.description: The traditional owners of Juukan Gorge have celebrated 10 years of native title determination and shared plans to safeguard heritage sites.

item.title: NASA Mars rover Perseverance finds best potential evidence yet of ancient life
item.description: NASA scientists say it is the closest they have come to discovering ancient life on Mars.

item.title: Is the pink soap scum in my bathroom mould, or something else?
item.description: Have you ever noticed a pink or orange-coloured substance in the tile grout or around taps in your bathroom? In most cases, it's one of two things.

item.title: Exhibition of ceramic work by Purple House dialysis patients opens in Alice Springs
item.description: Between treatments, Purple House patients have been creating colourful works of ceramic art. The results are now on display in Alice Springs.

item.title: The simple system I use for composting
item.description: Koren Helbig has devised an easy and effective method of turning her food waste and plant trimmings into a nutrient-rich compost for her Adelaide/Tarntanya food gardens.

item.title: What were assassinated right-wing influencer Charlie Kirk's views?
item.description: Assassinated right-wing activist Charlie Kirk was an icon for young conservatives in the USA and Australia — so what were some of his views that so enraged some people, but energised others?

item.title: Sushila Karki sworn in as Nepal's new prime minister after gen Z protests prompt political change
item.description: Sushila Karki garnered widespread support from many young Nepalese people who took to the streets in anger over government corruption.

item.title: Evidence points to remains found in Vietnam cave being South-East Asia's earliest known homicide victim
item.description: It was on a sweltering morning in 2018 in a cave in northern Vietnam when Chris Stimpson and his team uncovered what may be the oldest cold case murder in South-East Asia.

item.title: Who is Tyler Robinson, the accused killer of Charlie Kirk?
item.description: After his father encouraged Tyler Robinson to turn himself in, people close to the 22-year-old provided investigators with crucial insights.

item.title: Erika Kirk makes first public statement after assassination of husband Charlie Kirk
item.description: Charlie Kirk's widow, Erika, delivers her first public remarks since the fatal shooting of her influencer husband.

item.title: From Formula 1 to creating the 'world's best' croissant, how baking saved Lune founder Kate Reid's life
item.description: Kate Reid's Lune croissants have been called the world's best. But how did a young woman struggling with a near-fatal eating disorder end up perfecting pastry?

item.title: 'White-hot anger' in the bush as Victorians fight government on multiple fronts
item.description: Rural residents and local councils are deeply unhappy with new taxes, renewable energy, bad roads and mining companies, accusing the state government of "city centric" policymaking.

item.title: How to watch the 2025 Primetime Emmys in Australia
item.description: Your pocket guide to watching the Emmy awards in Australia.

item.title: FBI director Kash Patel to face congressional hearing amid missteps on Charlie Kirk assassination
item.description: Kash Patel faces a clear test of whether he can convince the country that the FBI, under his watch, can avoid compounding its mistakes in a time of political violence and deepening distrust.

item.title: Family violence survivors waiting years for social housing as demand surges in Victoria
item.description: As family violence survivor and mother-of-two, Maya was assessed as a high priority for social housing. Eight years later, she's finally moved into a suitable home in outer-suburban Melbourne, with vulnerable Victorians left waiting for years as the social housing waitlist soars.

item.title: Nepalese migrants in Australia turning to parents to help with childcare and culture
item.description: For many Nepalese families living in Canberra, the arrival of parents from overseas is both a helping hand with raising children and a connection to their homeland.

item.title: WA's expanded container deposit scheme to cost wineries, distilleries millions
item.description: Producers in Western Australia's premier wine region say the state government's expanded bottle recycling scheme is set to cost them millions of dollars.

item.title: Emmy Awards 2025: The Pitt, Adolescence and The Studio win big as Owen Cooper makes history — as it happened
item.description: The Pitt wins Best Drama at the 77th Annual Primetime Emmy Awards, with The Studio, Adolescence and even Stephen Colbert walking away as the biggest winners of the night.

item.title: Outback ringmaster Fred Brophy takes his boxing tent to Birdsville for last time
item.description: Fred Brophy will sell you a ticket, spin you a yarn and dare you into the ring, but at 73, the outback ringmaster is slowing down.

item.title: Inquest hears prison system failed Aboriginal inmate before he died
item.description: A coronial inquest hears the system failed First Nations prisoner Clinton Austin before his death.

item.title: 2025 Emmys key moments: From Hacks star Hannah Einbinder's acceptance speech to chants for Stephen Colbert
item.description: From a rallying political cry from Hacks star Hannah Einbinder to standing ovations for Stephen Colbert, here are your Emmys 2025 key moments.

item.title: How much fish is in tinned tuna, and how to shop for your needs
item.description: When you're at the supermarket, do you wonder how much much tuna you're getting in a can? A series of popular social media has been comparing how much food there is in some packaged items.

item.title: How is Australia affected by climate change? The National Climate Risk Assessment models the future
item.description: For the first time, the government has modelled the threats from climate change on Australia's future. What's the point of a document like this, and can it help us avoid the worst-case scenarios?

item.title: Townsville Mayor Troy Thompson found to have breached code of conduct
item.description: Troy Thompson will be reprimanded and ordered to pay all costs after he was found to have breached the council's code of conduct.

item.title: Whispering Jack: The John Farnham Musical to premiere in Sydney Theatre Company's 2026 season
item.description: Whispering Jack: The John Farnham Musical is one of 13 plays coming to Sydney Theatre Company next year, alongside shows starring David Wenham and Miranda Otto.

item.title: DNA at crime scene matches Charlie Kirk murder suspect, FBI says
item.description: Tyler Robinson, 22, was arrested last week over the death of conservative influencer Charlie Kirk.

item.title: Climate Risk Assessment's 'high risk' warning for 1 million Australian homes
item.description: One in 10 homes could be effectively uninsurable by 2050, while lost labour productivity to extreme weather could wipe $211 billion in household wealth, the Climate Risk Assessment warns, with tourism, trade, and property values forecasted to take a dive.

item.title: Victorian childcare worker denies abusing toddlers, says he is appealing ban
item.description: A Goodstart worker who allegedly abused toddlers at a Ballarat centre speaks out for the first time and says he is appealing after being banned from working with children.

item.title: Western Sydney is set to dramatically heat up, this is how communities are preparing
item.description: A "shocking" warning that heatwave deaths could skyrocket brings the issue of urban heat back into sharp focus, particularly in the city's west.

item.title: How to determine if your kid is well enough for child care
item.description: Work demands and a lack of village mean keeping a child at home from care every time they have a sniffle can be a dilemma for many parents. So when it it OK to send them?

item.title: Where and how to watch the 2025 Primetime Emmy award-winning shows in Australia
item.description: From The Studio to The Pitt, here's how to stream the biggest winners of the 2025 Primetime Emmy Awards.

item.title: Aaron Chen talks comedy, faith, and moving to New York
item.description: How Aaron Chen went from being booted out of Sydney pubs to winning Logies and chasing global stardom.

item.title: Does washing your fruit and veggies remove chemicals?
item.description: This is what experts have to say about washing fruit and veggies, with removing chemicals and reducing the amount we consume in mind.

item.title: Concurrent disasters will overwhelm responders, stress ADF, risk report warns
item.description: A dedicated disaster recovery force is needed, or else responders and defence forces could be "overwhelmed" by multiple concurrent natural disasters, the National Climate Risk Assessment warns.

item.title: Israel is committing genocide in Gaza, major United Nations report finds
item.description: Israel has committed and is continuing to commit genocide in Gaza, according to the "most authoritative assessment" to date.

item.title: Donald Trump takes aim at ABC journalist as he suggests he'll meet Albanese 'very soon'
item.description: Donald Trump takes aim at the ABC's Americas editor during an extraordinary exchange at the White House, as the president suggests he will meet Prime Minister Anthony Albanese "very soon".

item.title: Charlie Kirk shooting suspect Tyler Robinson charged with murder as prosecutors seek death penalty
item.description: Utah prosecutors say they will seek the death penalty for the 22-year-old alleged shooter.

item.title: Australians too dependent on government, says Sussan Ley
item.description: In her first major economic speech, the opposition leader hits out at universal subsidies and says "dependency" has affected Australia's "national character".

item.title: Britain is hoping it has a secret weapon to charm Donald Trump this week: 'all his favourite things'
item.description: The US president has been given something no other world leader has ever received: a second state visit invitation from Buckingham Palace. But assessing the trip's success means looking beneath the pomp and pageantry.

item.title: SA's ongoing harmful algal bloom labelled 'cultural emergency' by First Nations groups
item.description: First Nations South Australians say the harmful algal bloom impacting the state's coastline is a cultural emergency, as it continues to devastate beaches.

item.title: New doco Signorinella: Little Miss celebrates the Italian women who shaped modern Australia
item.description: Signorinella: Little Miss, the new documentary from the filmmakers behind Lygon St — Si Parla Italiano, celebrates the tenacity of Italian Australian women in business and beyond.

item.title: South Australia's feral deer culling program targets eradication amid plague warning
item.description: South Australia has ramped up its feral deer aerial culling program as drought-affected farmers battle the pest on their properties.

item.title: Australia and PNG fail to clinch defence agreement, resorting to communique
item.description: A major defence treaty between Australia and Papua New Guinea has failed to get over the line today, with the countries resorting to signing a communique in lieu of the actual document.

item.title: Rainbow bee-eaters prevented from nesting on Qld festival site
item.description: Conservationists say one of the country's largest colonies of a protected native bird is under threat at a two-day festival site.

item.title: Court documents reveal how Charlie Kirk shooting suspect Tyler Robinson allegedly confessed
item.description: Key moments that led to the identification and arrest of the man accused of murdering Charlie Kirk have been laid out in fresh court documents released by US authorities.

item.title: Charlie Kirk murder suspect appears in court by video from jail
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Khapra beetle, a threat to grains industry, discovered in imported nappy pants
item.description: Authorities are investigating how khapra beetle, the number-one-priority pest for the grains industry, entered Australia.

item.title: Why 'everything feels easier' for Chloe Rykers since her breast reduction
item.description: Chloe Rykers says her "big boobs" had, in various ways, made her career harder and left her feeling uncomfortable and in pain.

item.title: Robert Redford's most notable movies with Jane Fonda, Barbra Streisand and Paul Newman
item.description: The Hollywood icon leaves a legacy of classic films with a career that stretched over decades.

item.title: Police fear missing Perth man Jayden Selfe dead as Attadale unit scoured for clues
item.description: WA Police's homicide squad takes over a major investigation into the whereabouts of a missing Perth man, which has seen officers spend almost a week searching a riverside property.

item.title: Jimmy Barnes, Dave Faulkner among music industry voices in open letter urging ANU to keep School of Music
item.description: Jimmy Barnes is among more than 40 music voices supporting an open letter to the embattled Australian National University (ANU) calling for the School of Music to be saved.

item.title: UTS to axe 1,100 subjects across education and public health, cuts 134 full-time jobs
item.description: The University of Technology Sydney will close its schools of education and public health under a multi-million-dollar restructure.

item.title: Albanese has found out nailing down Pacific agreements is harder than expected
item.description: Anthony Albanese was meant to emerge from his recent flurry of Pacific diplomacy holding no fewer than two major agreements — instead he's returning home conspicuously empty-handed.

item.title: Man charged with murder after bones found in search for Susan Goodwin
item.description: Bones have been found at a Port Lincoln property in the search for the remains of Susan Goodwin, who went missing in Port Lincoln decades ago.

item.title: Labor MP John Carey fathers five children through sperm donation, as WA surrogacy debate continues
item.description: Western Australian Labor MP John Carey reveals he is a sperm donor for five children, as parliament debates legislation to change the state's surrogacy and in vitro fertilisation (IVF) laws.

item.title: Hasan Piker opens up on Charlie Kirk's death, Donald Trump and Elon Musk's campaign against him
item.description: Prominent left-wing commentator Hasan Piker opens up to 7.30 on Donald Trump's left-wing crackdown, the Charlie Kirk he knew and attempts to have him deplatformed.

item.title: Gout Gout, Torrie Lewis, reach semifinal of 200m at the 2025 World Athletics Championships
item.description: Gout Gout powers home to claim third place in his heat and secure a spot in the 200m semifinals at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, after Torrie Lewis ran a PB to reach the semifinals.

item.title: Alexei Navalny's wife says new tests show former Russian opposition leader was poisoned
item.description: Yulia Navalnaya says that laboratory analysis of smuggled biological samples had found he was killed by poisoning while incarcerated in prison in February 2024.

item.title: Ben & Jerry's co-founder Jerry Greenfield quits over Gaza dispute with parent company Unilever
item.description: Ben & Jerry's co-founder Jerry Greenfield resigns after a feud with parent company Unilever over the war in Gaza.

item.title: King Charles hails 'vital' AUKUS relationship during state banquet for Donald Trump
item.description: King Charles praises the AUKUS defence pact between the US, UK and Australia during a state banquet for Donald Trump.

item.title: European Commission lays out new tariffs and sanctions on Israel over war in Gaza
item.description: The European Union's executive arm has made a series of proposals aimed at forcing an end to the Israel–Hamas conflict.

item.title: Australia's 2035 climate target will strike a middle path. Will it be enough?
item.description: Australia's next major climate commitment will be more ambitious than New Zealand's and Canada's, but less than the United Kingdom's, as the government strikes a middle path in pursuit of an "achievable" 2035 target.

item.title: NT regulator takes new side job with miner amid calls to quit over gas leak 'scandal'
item.description: The chair of the Northern Territory's Environment Protection Authority has become a "strategic adviser" to a miner but denies he has a conflict of interest.

item.title: Why rower Jean Mitchell got an Olympic rings tattoo over her chemo scar
item.description: Making it to the Paris 2024 Olympics was a career highlight for Jean Mitchell — and the brain cancer survivor marked the achievement in a special way.

item.title: Fears human rights activist Aung San Suu Kyi could 'die' in a 'hellhole' prison
item.description: One of the world's most recognised pro-democracy activists needs urgent medical care as she serves a 27-year sentence in a "hellhole" prison, her son has claimed.

item.title: Coal miner Anglo American confirms job cuts in Brisbane, Bowen Basin
item.description: Mining giant Anglo American confirms job cuts in Brisbane and the Bowen Basin in the wake of BHP Mitsubishi Alliance axing 750 workers.

item.title: Donald and Melania Trump receive royal welcome in UK
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Man claims council bid to remove 'therapy' roosters is contrary to human rights conventions
item.description: A South Australian council has taken a disability pensioner to court to remove his allegedly noisy roosters, but he has argued the council's application should not proceed because it is discriminatory and the birds are his "therapeutic" animals.

item.title: Northern WA communities already adapting to extreme climate future
item.description: Locals in small northern WA communities say the potential dangers identified by the Climate Risk Assessment are already starting to appear.

item.title: The Sydneysiders saving thousands by leaving the city on 'financial gap year'
item.description: As Sydneysiders struggle with the soaring cost of living, a teacher has found financial freedom thousands of kilometres away, while a digital marketer swaps the city for the bush to save up $100,000.

item.title: Gout Gout shows class to reach 200m semifinal at World Athletics Championships
item.description: Gout Gout could have been rattled competing against some of the world's best in the 200m at the World Athletics Championships, but powered through with an assured display beyond his years.

item.title: Rural citizen scientists monitor wildlife activity to help conservation
item.description: Citizen scientists have collected more than 1.4 million photos and 15,000 hours of audio recordings to help shape the future of conservation management.

item.title: Gaming history goes on display with Australian titles Hollow Knight Silksong and Team Fortress chronicled
item.description: An exhibition at Melbourne's ACMI will pull back the curtain on how iconic games like Hollow Knight Silksong, Team Fortress, Neopets and Sim City were made.

item.title: Federal politics live: Sussan Ley says Labor's 2035 climate modelling is in 'fantasy land'
item.description: The government has released the much-anticipated climate targets for 2035. Follow live.

item.description: The government has released the much-anticipated climate targets for 2035. Follow live.

item.title: Abu Dhabi consortium drops bid to take over Santos
item.description: The investment arm of Abu Dhabi's state-owned oil company has dropped its $30 billion takeover bid for Santos.

item.title: Live: ASX slips amid Santos sell-off, weak jobs data and 2035 emissions target
item.description: Australia's unemployment rate remains steady at 4.2 per cent in August with a decline in full-time employment that drove the overall drop in employment numbers, according to ABS. Follow live.

item.title: How youth orchestras foster lifelong friendships and open career pathways for musicians
item.description: With youth orchestras set to busk on the streets of Sydney and Melbourne this weekend, Australian musicians share how those orchestras helped shape their careers.

item.title: Cairns maternity ward named as exposure site in Far North Queensland measles outbreak
item.description: More locally acquired cases have been confirmed with exposure sites now including Cairns Hospital's maternity ward and areas on the Atherton Tablelands.

item.title: Kmart broke privacy laws by using facial recognition technology, commissioner finds
item.description: The privacy commissioner has found Kmart broke the Privacy Act with its use of facial recognition technology, ordering the retail giant not to repeat the practice.

item.title: Broken Hill launches LGBTQIA+ festival Rainbow in the Outback
item.description: The outback city of Broken Hill is no stranger to celebrating the LGBTQIA+ community, with a new festival focusing on diversity and inclusion launching last weekend.

item.title: Donald Trump's royal banquet dinner in pictures during historic state visit
item.description: Surrounded by high-level politicians, a media mogul, tech giants and athletes, the grandeur-loving US president was treated to a glowing spectacle at Windsor Castle.

item.title: Patient 'devastated' as Sydney's dedicated long COVID clinic to close
item.description: A patient of NSW's first dedicated long COVID clinic in Sydney says she is "devastated" and "bewildered" that it will close at the end of the month.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel Live pulled from air by US broadcaster ABC over 'insensitive' Charlie Kirk comments
item.description: The late-night talk show's host suggested during a monologue earlier this week that Charlie Kirk's alleged killer may have been a pro-Trump Republican.

item.title: Charlie Kirk shooting suspect Tyler Robinson surrendered in fear of being shot by police, sheriff says
item.description: Tyler Robinson, the Utah man accused of killing political activist Charlie Kirk, only agreed to surrender if it was done peacefully, a sheriff involved with his arrest says.

item.title: What time does Gout Gout run tonight? Nicola Olyslagers starts high jump campaign at World Athletics Championships
item.description: The Gout Gout mania continues with his 200m semifinal, Torrie Lewis in the corresponding women's race, and gold medal contenders Nicola Olyslagers and Eleanor Patterson in the high jump.

item.title: Man sets out to combat 'isolating experience' of spinal cord injury
item.description: David Ham says the reality of his spinal cord injury hit him when he returned home from hospital and had no-one to talk to with a similar experience.

item.title: Utah police describe circumstances of Charlie Kirk murder suspect's surrender
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: How the Collingwood Magpies are righting the ship this AFLW season
item.description: A year after finishing dead last in the AFLW, the Magpies have started making moves up the ladder thanks to a new approach at both ends of the field.

item.title: Charges against veteran broadcaster Alan Jones 'downgraded', some withdrawn
item.description: Eleven counts of aggravated indecent assault against the veteran broadcaster have been dropped in what the magistrate described as a "reformation" of the case.

item.title: Australian National University walks back plans for forced redundancies as part of major restructure
item.description: The Australian National University abandons its plans for forced redundancies as part of its efforts to cut costs.

item.title: Australian cow market at record high as US demand hits 'scary times'
item.description: Australian cow prices are at record highs, but are still way below the United States where beef demand is going "crazy".

item.title: Unemployment rate steady despite jobs losses in August
item.description: Australia's unemployment rate remains steady at 4.2 per cent in August, despite more than 5,000 jobs being lost last month.

item.title: Airline receives mixed reaction to pets on planes pilot program
item.description: Virgin Australia has finally announced the start date of a trial of pets on flights, beginning next month between Melbourne and the Gold and Sunshine coasts.

item.title: Three police officers dead and two wounded in rural Pennsylvania shooting
item.description: Pennsylvania police are investigating after three of their own were killed and another two wounded in a shooting near the rural area of North Codorus Township.

item.title: Australia vows to cut emissions 62 to 70 per cent by 2035
item.description: Australia will vow to cut its emissions by 62 to 70 per cent by 2035, lifting its sights further as the world strives to reach net zero emissions by 2050.

item.title: PNG's much-wanted NRL team has had setbacks. Experts say history is on its side
item.description: Observers say Papua New Guinea's decades-long history of rugby league success and passion is on its side as it prepares for the next sporting leap into the NRL.

item.title: Qantas axes Perth to Busselton flights less than three months after service launched
item.description: Low passenger numbers force Qantas to pull the plug on flights between Perth and Busselton, less than three months after the route was launched.

item.title: 'Just a joy': Margot Robbie and Colin Farrell on their movie A Big Bold Beautiful Journey
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Suspected murder victim Susan Goodwin's family thank all involved in search for remains
item.description: The family of suspected murder victim Susan Goodwin has issued a statement thanking authorities following the discovery of remains in a Port Lincoln backyard on Wednesday afternoon. A 64-year-old man has been charged with her alleged murder.

item.title: Suspended Townsville Mayor Troy Thompson hit with show-cause notice after CCC briefing
item.description: Queensland's local government minister tells state parliament that Troy Thompson may need to be sacked based on Crime and Corruption Commission allegations. Mr Thompson now has 14 days to respond to a show-cause notice.

item.title: SA Deputy Premier Susan Close and Treasurer Stephen Mullighan to quit politics
item.description: South Australia's Deputy Premier Susan Close and Treasurer Stephen Mullighan will quit politics and not contest next year's state election, Premier Peter Malinauskas has announced.

item.title: Brittany Higgins files last-day appeal over ex-senator Linda Reynolds's defamation win
item.description: Brittany Higgins lodges an appeal against a WA Supreme Court judgement that she defamed her former boss and ex-Liberal senator Linda Reynolds in social media posts.

item.title: Magpies overlook Bobby Hill for AFL preliminary final against Lions
item.description: Coach Craig McRae reveals he has spoken with Bobby Hill about his chances of playing in the AFL finals, as the Magpies ramp up preparations for Saturday's preliminary final against Lions.

item.title: Mal Lanyon addresses NYE controversy as race for top NSW Police job continues
item.description: Mal Lanyon — who is vying to become the next police commissioner — conceded he should have thought "more carefully" about taking his wife and two friends onboard a police boat on Sydney Harbour on New Year's Eve in 2023.

item.title: Female pedestrian dies after being hit by truck in Melbourne's north
item.description: Emergency crews treated the woman at the scene, but she could not be revived.

item.title: The AFL is in danger of becoming a 'two-tier competition' as multiple club captains search for the exit door
item.description: Three captains from the AFL's four worst-performing clubs are searching for the exit door. It is the symptom of a player movement era that has left the gap between the AFL's strongest and weakest larger than ever.

item.title: What are the best ways to clean windows and fly screens?
item.description: Windows and fly screens are often the first things we see when we walk into a home, but rarely at the top of the spring-cleaning to-do list. Experts share their tips on the easiest and most effective ways to clean them.

item.title: Australia's 2035 climate targets on path to net zero judged by the experts
item.description: After much anticipation, Australia has its new climate targets. Now that the dice have fallen, we consult experts on their assessment of how these targets stack up with what’s at stake.

item.title: Son, 28, charged with murder after allegedly assaulting parents on Father's Day
item.description: A 28-year-old Coffs Harbour man has been charged with murder and attempted murder after allegedly assaulting his parents and starting a house fire on Father's Day.

item.title: Amid Trump's biggest, best state visit ever, the king delivers a pointed message
item.description: Amid the diamonds, whisky sours and flattery of a royal banquet for Donald Trump's state visit, tiara diplomacy was on full display.

item.title: Authorities urge parents to check Little Ones Nappy Pants for khapra beetle larvae
item.description: Hundreds of cartons of nappy pants remain unaccounted for after one of the biggest threats to Australia's grain industry, khapra beetle larvae, was found in the imported products.

item.title: Former Canberra business owner jailed for sexual offences against three of her then-employees
item.description: A Canberra court hears a former business owner who pleaded guilty to sexual offences against three former employees has shown no remorse for her offending, instead portraying her actions as consensual to minimise her responsibility.

item.title: League steps in as Red Cliffs footy players accused of bullying journalist
item.description: A regional football league is demanding an explanation from one of its clubs over repeated comments about a journalist online.

item.title: Cats coach Chris Scott regrets run-in with AFL staffer after qualifying final
item.description: Geelong coach Chris Scott says long-held frustration with the AFL was behind his regrettable post-qualifying final win outburst at a junior league employee.

item.title: Patrick Kenneth Dolbey questioned about voice message at trial over murder of David Jenkins in 2022
item.description: A Tasmanian court hears a man left a voice message "minutes" after an alleged murder, saying he had just seen a person stabbed multiple times.

item.title: WA government flags tougher fishing rules, with dhufish and snapper at 'severe risk'
item.description: Prized fish species including dhufish, snapper and red emperor are at severe risk of population collapse along WA's coast, prompting the state government to flag even stricter measures to protect stocks.

item.title: Chris Rowbottom explains the Tasmanian government's plan to forge ahead with Hobart's proposed stadium
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Hobart stadium proponent dismisses planning commission key issues as 'matters of opinion'
item.description: The agency behind Hobart's Macquarie Point stadium build says it is undeterred by the three key issues raised by the recent planning commission's final report, arguing it comes down to "priorities".

item.title: Qantas to review staff bases in Mildura, Canberra and Hobart
item.description: There are concerns the decision could impact regional flights, as staff would have to travel from Sydney, Melbourne or Brisbane to get to work.
